summary: This is an email chain from December 27, 2019, discussing the potential participation of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman in a press conference for the New York State Child Victims Act, organized by Safe Horizon. The discussion includes considerations about inviting victims of Jeffrey Epstein to the event and the potential impact on the ongoing Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The primary subject of the email chain; his potential participation in a Child Victims Act press conference is being discussed, with considerations about the ongoing Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Michael Polenberg
persons.context: The organizer from Safe Horizon who is hoping Geoffrey Berman can participate in a press conference to publicize the Child Victims Act and is contemplating inviting victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the perpetrator whose victims might be invited to the Child Victims Act press conference; the email discusses the ongoing investigation related to him.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the ongoing Epstein-related investigation, and the email discusses the potential impact of the press event on that investigation.
Polenberg is seeking Berman's participation in a Safe Horizon press conference for the Child Victims Act.

events.title: Enactment of New York State Child Victims Act
events.description: The Child Victims Act (CVA) was enacted into law in New York State.

events.title: Opening of CVA one-year filing window
events.description: A one-year window began during which adult survivors of child sexual abuse could file civil suits regardless of statutes of limitations.

events.title: Planned Child Victims Act press conference
events.description: A press conference in Times Square is being planned for the week of January 27, 2020, to mark the one-year anniversary of the CVA and publicize the filing window.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively considering the public relations implications of its involvement in a victim advocacy event relative to the ongoing Epstein investigation.
Organizers of the Child Victims Act press conference contemplated inviting victims of Jeffrey Epstein to participate.
Geoffrey Berman explicitly stated he did not want to influence the event's invite list or create the suggestion that he wouldn't want Epstein victims to participate.
The email confirms an ongoing federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and co-conspirators as of December 2019.
The purpose of the planned event was to publicize the Child Victims Act and encourage victims to come forward, including specifically about Epstein.
